questions.question: What personnel are responsible for setting risk policies of the organization ?
Does the organization have a formal risk management policy ?
Does the organization have any policies or controls established to deal with information security risks relating to third parties ?
Does the organization comply to any security related standard (ISO 27001, NIST standards) ?
Does company policy describe roles and responsibilities of users that use external/third party systems/system components/system services ?
Does the organization keep records of documents relevant to third parties (e.g.- SLAs, contracts, agreements)?
Has the organization established safeguards to ensure that documents related to third-parties are secure ?
Does the organization have alternate storage sites for information that is held in external/third-party systems/system components/system services ?
If so, does the security of the alternate site match to a reasonable degree the security of the original site ? (if an alternate site is used)
Have third-parties been made aware of POCs (Point of Contact)?
Does the organization have an incident response plan/policy ?
Does the plan cover information security risks related to third parties? (if a plan is available)
Does the organization have a record/list of all information assets that are/a part of/stored can be accessed by any external/third party system/system components/system service ?
Are these assets categorized based on importance/confidentiality for the organization ?
Has the organization conducted a formal risk assessment ?
How often does the organization conduct risk assessments ?
Are risks associated with third parties and external/third-party systems/system components/system services considered in the risk assessment process ?
Are the risks determined and evaluated through risk assessments communicated to relevant authorized parties ?
Does the organization have a formal Service Level Agreement with all third-parties ?

answers.answer: No service level agreement was formed

questions.question: Does the organization perform security screening before obtaining/implementing an external/third-party system/system component/system service ?
Does the organization perform security audits on controls implemented to protect against third-party information security risks ?
Are external/third-party software licenses kept up to date ?

sections.section: Information and External systems and services

questions.question: Who manages the IT environment of the organizaion ?
Has the organization performed a criticality analysis of organizational and external/third-party systems/system components/ system services ?
Does the organization use default accounts for external/third-party systems/system components/system services ?
Do users have admin access to any organizational/third-party system/system component/system service ?
How long before a device is set to lock when not in use/a user is away from the device ?
Does the organization limit access to data for any third-party or third-party system/system component/system service ?

answers.answer: Yes, access is limited to job role

questions.question: Does the organization have an up-to-date patch management plan ?
How does the organization complete updates ?

answers.answer: Only when prompted by the device/application

questions.question: How frequently are updates conducted ?
Is the organization using a firewall between the internal and external network ?
Does the end devices of the organization have host-based firewalls installed ?
How are organizational firewalls managed ?
Does the organization use specialized accounts and credentials for firewall management access ?
Are firewalls configured to log activity based on logging policies of the organization ?
Does the organization use WIFI/wireless connections ?
What authentication method does the organization use for its wireless connections (Wifi)? (If the organization uses a wireless connection)
Has the organization changed the default password for its wireless connections ? (If a password based authentication is used)
Has the organization changed the default configurations/passwords for network devices such as switches and routers ?
Has the organization implemented security measures for networking devices such as port security, ACLs, console and virtual line securing ?
Does the organization scan external systems/system components/ system services for rogue access points and unused services ?
Does the organization have a communication plan in place to communicate with third parties in case of security incidents, for reports etc. ?
Does the organization have any policies/frameworks/agreements set, to manage the communication with organizational personnel/systems and third parties/external systems/external system services ?
Has the organization identified security requirements for information that is to be communicated based on the category of the information and the third-party it is to be communicated to ?
Has the organization documented interface characteristics of the organizational/third-party systems/system components/system services that communicate information?
Does the interface characteristics match the security requirements for the information to be communicated ? (if requirements have been selected)
Does the organization employ methods such as cryptography to secure the confidentiality and integrity of information that is communicated to/via third parties/ external systems/system services ?
Does the organization take steps such as cryptography to secure the confidentiality and integrity of the relevant information that is at rest/stored in external systems/systems services ?
